part.narration: NoLifeQueen and satchmo_omega walk through the greenhouse on the waterfall's slope. The rapids slink over the glass.
part.line: This is pretty relaxing.
Monsieur Soleil built it as a place for administrators to relax.
But we aren't here to relax, are we?
We're here to delete and sort some files.
What kind of files?
The source.
There are gigabytes of unused resources from Phantasy Star 5 here.
If we leave them laying around, we'll have a lot more crackers to deal with.
Just take the books from the light blue shelves and delete them.
part.narration: Satchmo walks to the other end of the building. Before NoLifeQueen is a row of shelves. NoLifeQueen urges player to close in on shelf to accurately pick out books. Main action is delete.NoLifeQueen takes a book. She deletes it. Pages flutter through the calm indoor air, dissipating into clouds of hex.
part.line: Meaningless patterns of flashing lights.
We sit in dark rooms laughing and crying for shifting pixels timed to symboled buttons.
This is how we communicate with computers.
My love for the machine stems from its objective linguistics.
Father made computers communicate with us through a simulation.
What did he use?
An abstract, ludologically metaphorical representation of system entities.
A realistic, simulative representation of user actions.
A concrete, narrative exposition of system events.
Such implementation is still in its infancy, awaiting the harshest of malicious attacks—
part.narration: Crashes through the window bring helicopters and army-men and a man in a suit who comes by and greets NoLifeQueen in the face and those army-men push NoLifeQueen and satchmo to the ground and the man who had greeted NoLifeQueen in the face comes down and he says:
part.line: Greetings, minions of the New Parisian-Nagoyan Network!
After much ado about a lot, we proudly present:
The Group's Third Demonstration!
Since our day-longs don't seem to move you, we've come up with something more devastating.
As I speak, our engineers are extracting the resources from Phantasy Star 5,
and merging the data with the game itself and our own brand of file system-corrupting code.
Don't do anything stupid, Mademoiselle.
part.narration: In Real Life, Nozomi whispers to Yuki.Cut to Yuki and Nozomi sitting on the bed in Yuki's room.
part.line: Hey, honey.
Let's do something stupid.
I heard that.
part.narration: Enemies fill the room and wreck up the place. NoLifeQueen and Satchmo are still pinned to the ground. In Real Life, they whisper.Stay focused on NoLifeQueen and Satchmo.
part.line: Perfect — I'll cover you, you go through the escape tunnel at the end of the room.

choice.line: I'll never leave you behind, my love.
Oh, stop — you know how your flattery depresses me.

part.narration: The two make ready their plan.Ramp up a sound. Any action from the player sets everything off.
part.line: Three —
Two —

choice.narration: The enemies are surprised! Most charge after Satchmo.
NoLifeQueen dashes off. The enemies expected something like that. Most charge after NoLifeQueen.

part.line: Survive! Only the real survive!
part.narration: NoLifeQueen runs to the escape tunnel entrance. She jumps in and then the game environment changes and she's for some reason not in an escape tunnel.
part.line: What —
It's taking effect! Already, the input/output corruption errors are occurring.
What the hell!
My Clan is quite large and will take care of you shortly,
but I'm always game for some one-on-one!
part.narration: They get into a fight. As the fight goes on, the environment continues to shift in shape and size and form and location. A shift. The man is gone. NoLifeQueen is in the escape tunnel. She cheers.
part.line: Hey, I made it to the escape tunnel.
part.narration: Surrounded by the enemy.Cut to further away view.
part.line: Get her!
part.narration: They chase NoLifeQueen through the tunnel and over the bridge and through the bridge and through the bridge and over the tunnel and through the bridge and around the cliff then off the cliff then off the cliff again. Everybody falls and falls and falls and then falls again and then finally falls to the ground.Black out screen.
NoLifeQueen comes to. Her head is pinned to the railing of the bridge. She opens her eyes. Surrounded. One hundred enemies.Zoom out here, too.NoLifeQueen against a world.

Yuki throws her computer at her bed. She thrashes about.Player can move her around but not prevent her from thrashing. Yuki occasionally pushes the cursor away.After this point in the game, computers in the Studio break extremely frequently.
